Class BracketPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • BracketPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class BracketPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
    Created by Richard and Ricardo on 5/3/17. Edited by Dov and AJ primarily, with small additions from Phoenix and Andrew E BracketPane handles the display and management of all Brackets. It also provides navigational tools to view sections of the Bracket at a time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BracketPane.BracketNode
      The BracketNode model for the Graphical display of the "Bracket"
      private class  BracketPane.Root
      Creates the graphical representation of a subtree.

      • helper

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> helper(int root,
                                                     int pos)
        Helpful method to retrieve our magical numbers. Each number corresponds to the index of a BracketNode.
        Parameters:
        root - the root node (3,4,5,6)
        pos - the position in the tree (8 (16) , 4 (8) , 2 (4) , 1 (2))
        Returns:
        The list representing the valid values.

      • highlightCorrect

        public void highlightCorrect(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> correctIndices)
        Highlights correctly predicted team wins
        Parameters:
        correctIndices - the indices that correspond node with a correct prediction Phoenix

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Requests a message from current bracket to tell if the bracket has been completed.
        Returns:
        True if completed, false otherwise.

      • isFinalized

        public boolean isFinalized()
        Returns whether or not the pane has been finalized
        Returns:
        true if the current-bracket is complete and the value of finalized is also true.

      • resetBracket

        public void resetBracket()
        Resets the bracket-display
